labels.label: Custom process group to obtain variables of interest To add more, please navigate to inside this process group

Other hardcoded attributes can be declared here --> Please do not modify the following attributes in the processor - base_path - source_system - country - partition
The input directory of the ListFile processor currently must be hardcoded
Wait for all tables metadata update before recon trigger

config.comments:
This processor with take below arguments to log the message in particular format
parameters ------------------- -s = source name -c = country name -e = error code -m = message -l = log_path
Location need to be updated as of now its given as "/tmp"
Filename: ${error_code}:${error_message} ${system}:${country} Sample: 01:Fetch param File Failed for acb:ab

Routing to two separate streams, if the Spark tokenisation script is successful, it will route to the success flow, otherwise it will route to the failure flow.

The ListFile processor is the first in the NiFi flow, it will pick up any files in a source system and countrys archival folder. The file will need to be structured as followed to be picked up:
sourcesystem_country_integrated_recon_completion_yyyy-MM-dd.ack
This will grab the XML file that corresponds to the source system and country pulled from the previous processor.

entry.key: Log level when file not found

value.name: Log level when file not found

entry.key: Log level when file not found

config.comments: This processor runs a Python script which checks for any failed tables. If it detects any, then those tables are removed from the list of successful tables that will run on the next processors to update the Public Cloud tables.

This processor will grab the source system and country from the file name, as well as the target partition date. The source system and country variables are used to determine the config file to read in down the flow to get all the required attributes of a given source system and country.
Additionally, any hardcoded values that are needed throughout the flow, such as the abfs prefix, can be added in here too

This process runs a msck repair table for a given table in the Public Cloud environment, this is to enable the Public Cloud table to recognise the new partition saved from the Spark tokenisation script

This processor with take below arguments to log the message in particular format
parameters ------------------- -s = source name -c = country name -e = error code -m = message -l = log_path

processors.name: Logging - Data copy Python File Checker

config.comments: Split the incoming Hive commands from the Python script so that only one given table can be updated per flowfile, this is to allow some tables to fail, and some to succeed as opposed to all failing should something be wrong with the single Hive command.

This is the processor that calls the Spark tokenisation script to tokenise the required columns of a table, and save the result into the ADLS Gen2 storage underpinning the Public Cloud Data Hub cluster. All fields to start the job are extracted from the parameter file from the previous process group, the target partition for this job is extracted from the original acknowledgement file that triggered the flow to initially start (from the ListFile processor).
